description: Retrieves properties for one or more player sessions. This action can be used in the following ways: To request player sessions, specify either a player session ID, game session ID, or player ID. You can filter this request by player session status. If you provide a specific PlayerSessionId or PlayerId, Amazon GameLift ignores the filter criteria. Use the pagination parameters to retrieve results as a set of sequential pages. If successful, a PlayerSession object is returned for each session that matches the request. All APIs by task.

parameters.name: PlayerSessionStatusFilter
parameters.description: Player session status to filter results on. Note that when a PlayerSessionId or PlayerId is provided in a DescribePlayerSessions request, then the PlayerSessionStatusFilter has no effect on the response. Possible player session statuses include the following: RESERVED --- The player session request has been received, but the player has not yet connected to the server process and/or been validated. ACTIVE --- The player has been validated by the server process and is currently connected. COMPLETED --- The player connection has been dropped. TIMEDOUT --- A player session request was received, but the player did not connect and/or was not validated within the timeout limit (60 seconds).

nested_items.name: PlayerSessions
nested_items.description: A collection of objects containing properties for each player session that matches the request.

nested_items.name: PlayerSessionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for a player session.

nested_items.name: PlayerId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for a player that is associated with this player session.

nested_items.name: GameSessionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the game session that the player session is connected to.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the fleet that the player's game session is running on.

nested_items.name: FleetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name ( ARN) associated with the GameLift fleet that the player's game session is running on.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A time stamp indicating when this data object was created. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

nested_items.name: TerminationTime
nested_items.description: A time stamp indicating when this data object was terminated. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Current status of the player session.

nested_items.name: IpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address of the game session. To connect to a Amazon GameLift game server, an app needs both the IP address and port number.

nested_items.name: DnsName
nested_items.description: The DNS identifier assigned to the instance that is running the game session. Values have the following format:

nested_items.type: See Amazon EC2 Instance IP Addressing.
nested_items.description: Non-TLS-enabled fleets: ec2-<unique identifier>.compute.amazonaws.com. (See Amazon EC2 Instance IP Addressing.)

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Port number for the game session. To connect to a Amazon GameLift server process, an app needs both the IP address and port number.

nested_items.name: PlayerData
nested_items.description: Developer-defined information related to a player. Amazon GameLift does not use this data, so it can be formatted as needed for use in the game.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A token that indicates where to resume retrieving results on the next call to this operation. If no token is returned, these results represent the end of the list.
